an11.17:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, na titthaṁ jānāti, na pītaṁ jānāti, na vīthiṁ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
an11.17:1.3.en: It’s when a cowherd doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

an11.17:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, na titthaṁ jānāti, na pītaṁ jānāti, na vīthiṁ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
an11.17:2.3.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

an11.17:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti?
an11.17:4.1.en: And how is a mendicant not skilled in characteristics?

an11.17:4.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti.
an11.17:4.3.en: That’s how a mendicant isn’t skilled in characteristics.

an11.17:15.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako rūpaññū hoti, lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, titthaṁ jānāti, pītaṁ jānāti, vīthiṁ jānāti, gocarakusalo hoti, sāvasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti—
an11.17:15.3.en: It’s when a cowherd knows form, is skilled in characteristics, picks out flies’ eggs, dresses wounds, smokes out pests, knows the ford, knows satisfaction, knows the trail, is skilled in pastures, doesn’t milk dry, and shows extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

an11.17:16.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpaññū hoti, lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, titthaṁ jānāti, pītaṁ jānāti, vīthiṁ jānāti, gocarakusalo hoti, sāvasesadohī ca hoti, ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
an11.17:16.3.en: It’s when a mendicant knows form, is skilled in characteristics, picks out flies’ eggs, dresses wounds, smokes out pests, knows the ford, knows satisfaction, knows the trail, is skilled in pastures, doesn’t milk dry, and shows extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

an11.17:18.1.en: And how is a mendicant skilled in characteristics?

an11.17:18.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu lakkhaṇakusalo hoti.
an11.17:18.3.en: That’s how a mendicant is skilled in characteristics.

mn33:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, na titthaṁ jānāti, na pītaṁ jānāti, na vīthiṁ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti anavasesadohī ca hoti. Ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
mn33:2.3.en: It’s when a cowherd doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

mn33:3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, na titthaṁ jānāti, na pītaṁ jānāti, na vīthiṁ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti. Ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
mn33:3.3.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

mn33:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti?
mn33:5.1.en: And how is a mendicant not skilled in characteristics?

mn33:5.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti.
mn33:5.3.en: That’s how a mendicant isn’t skilled in characteristics.

mn33:15.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako rūpaññū hoti, lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, titthaṁ jānāti, pītaṁ jānāti, vīthiṁ jānāti, gocarakusalo hoti, sāvasesadohī ca hoti. Ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
mn33:15.3.en: It’s when a cowherd knows form, is skilled in characteristics, picks out flies’ eggs, dresses wounds, smokes out pests, knows the ford, knows satisfaction, knows the trail, is skilled in pastures, doesn’t milk dry, and shows extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

mn33:16.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpaññū hoti, lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, titthaṁ jānāti, pītaṁ jānāti, vīthiṁ jānāti, gocarakusalo hoti, sāvasesadohī ca hoti. Ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti.
mn33:16.3.en: It’s when a mendicant knows form, is skilled in characteristics, picks out flies’ eggs, dresses wounds, smokes out pests, knows the ford, knows satisfaction, knows the trail, is skilled in pastures, doesn’t milk dry, and shows extra respect to senior mendicants of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha.

mn33:18.1.en: And how is a mendicant skilled in characteristics?

mn33:18.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu lakkhaṇakusalo hoti.
mn33:18.3.en: That’s how a mendicant is skilled in characteristics.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 33
The Longer Discourse on the Cowherd

pli-tv-kd19:3.4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi pārājikassa dhammassa ajjhāpatti hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati pārājikaṁ dhammaṁ ajjhāpajjantaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.4.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone committing an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-kd19:3.5.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi sikkhā paccakkhātā hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati sikkhaṁ paccakkhantaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.5.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone renouncing the training.

pli-tv-kd19:3.6.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi dhammikāya sāmaggiyānupagamanaṁ hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati dhammikaṁ sāmaggiṁ na upentaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.6.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who doesn’t go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd19:3.7.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi dhammikāya sāmaggiyā paccādānaṁ hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati dhammikaṁ sāmaggiṁ paccādiyantaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.7.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who reopens a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd19:3.8.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi sīlavipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkito hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati sīlavipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkitaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.8.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd19:3.9.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi ācāravipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkito hoti tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati ācāravipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkitaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.9.2.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct.

pli-tv-kd19:3.9.13.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi diṭṭhivipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkito hoti, tehi ākārehi tehi liṅgehi tehi nimittehi bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ passati diṭṭhivipattiyā diṭṭhasutaparisaṅkitaṁ.
pli-tv-kd19:3.9.13.en: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view.

an3.47:1.4.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi saṅkhatassa saṅkhatalakkhaṇānī”ti.
an3.47:1.4.en: These are the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena.”

an3.47:2.4.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi asaṅkhatassa asaṅkhatalakkhaṇānī”ti.
an3.47:2.4.en: These are the three characteristics of unconditioned phenomena.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 3
5. The Lesser Chapter
47. Characteristics of the Conditioned

an3.3:1.1.en: “There are these three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of a fool.

an3.3:1.8.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi bālassa bālalakkhaṇāni bālanimittāni bālāpadānāni.
an3.3:1.8.en: These are the three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of a fool.

an3.3:2.1.pli: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, paṇḍitassa paṇḍitalakkhaṇāni paṇḍitanimittāni paṇḍitāpadānāni.
an3.3:2.1.en: There are these three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of an astute person.

an3.3:2.8.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi paṇḍitassa paṇḍitalakkhaṇāni paṇḍitanimittāni paṇḍitāpadānāni.
an3.3:2.8.en: These are the three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of an astute person.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.8.pli: Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:1.6.8.en: In this way I recollected many past lives with their characteristics and particulars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno itthiliṅgaṁ pātubhūtaṁ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.6.1.en: At one time the characteristics of a woman appeared on a monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.6.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā bhikkhuniyā purisaliṅgaṁ pātubhūtaṁ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:10.6.6.en: At one time the characteristics of a man appeared on a nun.

mn129:2.1.en: “These are the three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of a fool.

mn129:27.1.pli: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, paṇḍitassa paṇḍitalakkhaṇāni paṇḍitanimittāni paṇḍitāpadānāni.
mn129:27.1.en: There are these three characteristics, signs, and manifestations of an astute person.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 129
The Foolish and the Astute

pli-tv-kd1:6.27.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṁ tiparivaṭṭaṁ dvādasākāraṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ na suvisuddhaṁ ahosi, neva tāvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddhoti paccaññāsiṁ.
pli-tv-kd1:6.27.1.en: So long as I had not fully purified my knowledge and vision according to reality of these four noble truths with their three stages and twelve characteristics, I didn’t claim the supreme full awakening in this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and people.

pli-tv-kd1:6.28.1.pli: Yato ca kho me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṁ tiparivaṭṭaṁ dvādasākāraṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ suvisuddhaṁ ahosi, athāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddhoti paccaññāsiṁ.
pli-tv-kd1:6.28.1.en: But when I had fully purified my knowledge and vision according to reality of these four noble truths with their three stages and twelve characteristics, then I did claim the supreme full awakening in this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and people.

an11.22:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṁ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṁ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṁ kattā hoti, na titthaṁ jānāti, na pītaṁ jānāti, na vīthiṁ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti, anavasesadohī ca hoti, ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hoti—
an11.22:1.3.en: It’s when a cowherd doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know satisfaction, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.

Verses of the Senior Monks
The Book of the Twenties
Chapter One
16.6. Sela

dn27:16.7.pli: Yathā yathā kho te, vāseṭṭha, sattā akaṭṭhapākaṁ sāliṁ paribhuñjantā tambhakkhā tadāhārā ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu tathā tathā tesaṁ sattānaṁ bhiyyoso mattāya kharattañceva kāyasmiṁ okkami, vaṇṇavevaṇṇatā ca paññāyittha, itthiyā ca itthiliṅgaṁ pāturahosi purisassa ca purisaliṅgaṁ.
dn27:16.7.en: But so long as they ate that ripe untilled rice, their bodies became more solid and they diverged in appearance. And female characteristics appeared on women, while male characteristics appeared on men.
